Material used.Material Source: Primary cultures of rat cortical cells and mesencephalic neurons
Material used.Material Name: Primary cortical neurons and mesencephalic neurons
Material used.Description: Primary cultures of rat cortical cells were prepared from neonatal Wistar rats. Primary cultures of mesencephalic neurons were prepared from the mesencephali of mouse embryos at embryonic day 15.

Readout description.Result Description: The overexpression of A53T α-synuclein led to an increase in the number of EGFP-LC3 positive autophagosomes and an increased number of mitochondria that colocalized with autophagosomes.

Biological replicates.Description: At least 15 cell bodies or 18 axonal fragments were analyzed per group.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The Mann-Whitney or Student’s t test and one-way ANOVA, followed by a Newman-Keuls posthoc test or Kruskal-Wallis test, followed by a Dunn’s test were used to compare the differences between the samples and the control group.

Material used.Material Name: Primary cortical neurons and mesencephalic neurons
Material used.Description: For Western blot analysis, the cells were lysed and equivalent amounts of total protein were separated by SDS-PAGE and then transferred to membranes.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: increased LC3-I cleavage into LC3-II and increased turnover of p62/SQSTM1
Readout description.Result Description: A53T α-synuclein overexpression enhanced LC3-I cleavage into LC3-II and increased the turnover of p62/SQSTM1.

Basic positive control.Description: Primary antibodies were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: No specific negative control mentioned, but the absence of primary antibody would serve as an implicit negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Densitometric analysis using a QuantityOne 710 System.
